headline: Tell HN: I hate links to videos in discussions
description:
This is a rant of sorts, but I'm seeing this more and more, not just on HN, but in lots of places.

Folks will be discussing some topic (the genre doesn't seem to matter) and a commenter will respond with something like, "yeah, this is just like..." or something similar, and include a youtube (or other video) link without any context or reason why it's relevant or any inkling as to the content of such a video.

What then? Now I either have to go off whatever site I'm reading and watch some video that may or may not have anything to do with the subject at hand.

Even worse, like most people I can read a lot faster than some talking head in a video can get to the point, thus wasting my time.

Or I can just move on to the next comment and ignore the video link. Which might be rather unfortunate, as there may actually be something useful/interesting/informative going on.

For my own part, I may sometimes link to videos, but only in the context of a comment where I'm actually making the point in the comment itself and linking to the video to either support my point, provide additional context and/or act as a citation of something I've quoted/referenced in my comment.

Seeing stuff like "This is why $issue is how it is" or "$RandomPerson will [blow your mind|explain everything|is so profound]" with no context or other information really doesn't add anything valuable to the discussion at hand.

For pity's sake, if you're on a discussion site, then discuss stuff! If a video presents an interesting viewpoint or useful information, include it in your comment with a note that the linked video provides more informtion/context/argument, etc.

But a comment that contains nothing but "this is amazing" or "$person nailed it here" is, quite literally, clickbait. And not even good clickbait.

I get that some folks aren't native English speakers and may feel that the video will provide a much better explanation of their thoughts than the poster thinks they can exposit. But please, at least provide some kind of context!

I come to discussion sites to discuss, not watch videos. If I wanted to watch videos, I'd do that instead.

/rant

I generally just ignore such links/comments, because I'm here (and elsewhere) to discuss stuff.

Am I being overly judgemental here, or do others also feel that such "comments" reduce the value of a discussion if it's necessary to go off-site to view (sometimes hours-long) videos just to figure out what the commenter is banging on about?

Your thoughts?
